thread.title: Warriors coach Kerr to miss opener with bad back
thread.title_full: Warriors coach Kerr to miss opener with bad back

title: Warriors coach Kerr to miss opener with bad back
text:
Warriors coach Kerr to miss opener with bad back Source: Shanghai Daily | October 26, 2015, Monday | Print Edition 
Golden State Warriors coach Steve Kerr will miss the NBA season opener as he continues to recover from back surgery. General manager Bob Myers told reporters on Saturday that interim coach Luke Walton will coach the team for the season opener against the New Orleans Hornets tomorrow in Oakland. Kerr will be on hand for the ceremony to raise the team’s NBA championship banner in the arena, however. Kerr has been sidelined since the opening week of training camp because of complications from offseason back surgery. The Warriors do not know when he will be healthy enough to return. The Warriors won the NBA title last season in Kerr’s first season as coach.
